title: Test lint enforcement
description: Testing that the lint hook fires

title: Model tiering: optimize subagent model selection
description:
All subagent dispatches inherit Opus. Agent .md files lack proper YAML frontmatter. Skills dispatch general-purpose everywhere. Add model tiering (opus/sonnet/haiku) to agents and skills.

## Success Criteria
- All 6 agents have proper YAML frontmatter with name, description, model, tools
- commit skill runs on haiku, compress-prompt on sonnet
- feedback and review fix dispatches use sonnet
- Review lenses merged from 4 to 2
- rules/model-tiering.md documents the policy
- /agents command shows all agents with correct config

title: Merge review lenses 4→2 and add sonnet fix dispatch
description:
Two changes in review/SKILL.md:

## Change 1: Merge Step 3 lenses (4→2)

Replace 4 lens prompts with 2 merged lenses:

Lens 1: Correctness & Security — merge Lens 2 + Lens 3. Combined: edge cases, invalid states, race conditions, resource leaks, injection, auth gaps, data exposure, secrets, crypto misuse.

Lens 2: Architecture & Performance — merge Lens 1 + Lens 4. Combined: incomplete refactors, abstractions, dead code, coupling, simplicity, algorithmic complexity, memory, I/O, concurrency.

Update Step 3 intro from 'Spawn 4' to 'Spawn 2'.
Update Step 4 to reference 2 reviewers.

## Change 2: Step 5 fix agent → sonnet

old_string:
```
Spawn general-purpose agent with:
```

new_string:
```
Spawn general-purpose agent (model: "sonnet") with:
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Step 3 has exactly 2 lens prompts (not 4)
- Step 5 dispatch includes model: sonnet
- All original review focus areas covered across the 2 lenses

title: Add YAML frontmatter to all 6 agent definitions
description:
Add required YAML frontmatter (name, description, model, tools) to all agents in ~/.claude/agents/.

## Agent Config

| Agent | model | tools |
|-------|-------|-------|
| implementer | sonnet | Read, Edit, Write, Bash, Glob, Grep |
| researcher | haiku | Read, Glob, Grep |
| reviewer | sonnet | Read, Glob, Grep, Bash |
| tester | sonnet | Read, Edit, Write, Bash, Glob, Grep |
| architect | inherit | Read, Glob, Grep, Bash |
| devil | inherit | Read, Glob, Grep |

## Example (implementer.md)

```yaml
---
name: implementer
description: Follows plans precisely. Writes minimal code to satisfy requirements. No scope creep. Use for mechanical code changes from explicit instructions.
model: sonnet
tools: Read, Edit, Write, Bash, Glob, Grep
---
```

Keep existing markdown body unchanged. Just prepend frontmatter.

## Files
- ~/.claude/agents/implementer.md
- ~/.claude/agents/researcher.md
- ~/.claude/agents/reviewer.md
- ~/.claude/agents/tester.md
- ~/.claude/agents/architect.md
- ~/.claude/agents/devil.md

## Acceptance Criteria
- All 6 agents have valid YAML frontmatter with name, description, model, tools
- Existing markdown body unchanged
- model values match table above

title: Add model: haiku to commit skill frontmatter
description:
Add model: haiku to commit/SKILL.md YAML frontmatter.

## Edit

File: ~/.claude/skills/commit/SKILL.md

old_string:
```
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
```

new_string:
```
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
model: haiku
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- model: haiku present in commit/SKILL.md frontmatter
- Rest of file unchanged

title: Add model: sonnet to split-commit Phase 2 dispatch
description:
Change split-commit Phase 2 per-commit dispatch to sonnet.

## Edit

File: ~/.claude/skills/split-commit/SKILL.md

old_string:
```
Dispatch one subagent per commit, **sequentially**:
```

new_string:
```
Dispatch one subagent per commit (model: "sonnet"), **sequentially**:
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Phase 2 dispatch includes model: sonnet
- Phase 1 dispatch unchanged (stays opus/inherit)
- Rest of file unchanged

title: Add model: sonnet to compress-prompt + haiku nested dispatches
description:
Two changes in compress-prompt/SKILL.md:

## Edit 1: Frontmatter

old_string:
```
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
```

new_string:
```
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
model: sonnet
```

## Edit 2: Nested dispatch

old_string:
```
   - subagent_type: "general-purpose"
```

new_string:
```
   - subagent_type: "general-purpose"
   - model: "haiku"
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- model: sonnet in frontmatter
- model: haiku in nested Task dispatch
- Rest of file unchanged

- Rest of file unchanged

title: Create rules/model-tiering.md documentation
description:
Create ~/.claude/rules/model-tiering.md documenting model tiering policy.

## Content

- Three tiers: Deep (opus), Standard (sonnet), Fast (haiku)
- Skill assignments table
- Effort level note (session-only via CLAUDE_CODE_EFFORT_LEVEL)
- Escalation policy (sonnet fails → bump to opus)
- CLAUDE_CODE_SUBAGENT_MODEL env var note

## Acceptance Criteria
- File exists at ~/.claude/rules/model-tiering.md
- All three tiers documented with examples
- Effort limitation clearly stated
